newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Mergers spark increased shr bids.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Mergers spark increased shr bids.

text.p: A series of corporate mergers announced early Tuesday touched off vigorous bidding for the target companies before the market open as investors sought takeover-premium windfalls, traders said.
Great Western Financial Corp shares were bid up to 38-1/2 from 34-1/4 after H.F. Ahmanson and Co said it is offering $42.53 per share for Great Western.
Ahmanson shares made no moves preceding Tuesday's market open, they said.

Also, Renaissance Hotel Group N.V. shares rose to 29-5/8 from 25-1/8 after Marriott International Inc said it agreed to acquire Renaissance for $30 per share cash in a deal worth a totoal of $1 billion.
Related to the announcement were higher bids for shares in Doubletree Corp, bid up 3/8 to 41.
Doubletree announced in December an agreement to buy Renaissance for $850 million in cash and stock, but said this morning after the Marriott announcement it would no longer pursue Renaissance.
"Doubletree went out at 40-1/2 and looks like it will open up at least a dollar," a trader said.
In another huge merger, Healthsouth Corp said it will exchange 0.42169 of each of its shares for every Horizon/CMS Healthcare Corp share in a $1.6 billion merger.
In dollar terms, the deal values Horizon at about $18.18 per share, up from Horizon's $14.25 close February 14, and traders said Horizon shares were bid at 15-3/4.
Traders said the announcement brough early selling to Healthsouth shares, which they said are expected to open at around 41 to 42, off from 43-1/8.
Evergreen Media Corp shares rose to 33-1/6 from 32-3/4 and Chancellor Broadcasting Co shares traded up to 29-5/8 from 27-15/16.
Evergreen said it would acquire Chancellor in a stock swap.
